pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:0.5: 73. The training rule on defecating while standing
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were defecating and urinating while standing. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.3: “‘When not sick, I will not defecate or urinate while standing,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.4: If one is not sick, one should not defecate or urinate while standing.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.5: If, out of disrespect, a monk who is not sick defecates or urinates while standing, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.9: The thirteenth training rule is finished.
